casebody.data:
Thomas Bullitt DIXON, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. AMERICAN TELEPHONE & TELEGRAPH COMPANY, Western Electric Company, and Electrical Research Products, Inc., Defendants-Appellees. No. 99. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Jan. 4, 1937. James J. Kennedy, Jr., of New York City (James J. Kennedy, of New York City, of counsel), for appellant. Merrell E. Clark, Henry R. Ashton, and John McGlone, all of New York City, for appellees.

Before MANTON, SWAN, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree (12 F.Supp. 996), affirmed.
